Audit.description: Manage the object store audit logging

Expiration.description: The duration to keep logs for

Offline.description: The duration to keep logs before sending to offline storage

ReplicationRules.description: Manage replication of the audit bucket to another location

Id.description: The unique Id of the destination that will receive the data

ProviderId.description: The Cloud Provider Id of where the destination is hosted - set to __local__ for own account

Filters.description: The filters to apply on objects that should be replicated

Type.description: The type of prefix to use

Type:Prefix.description: Prefix specific controls applied on the filter

Prefix.description: The prefix to filter objects based on

Priority.description: The priority of the rule when handling conflicts

Console.description: Configuration control for virtual machine consoles

Encryption.description: Enable encryption of all content between the virtual machine and the console service

DedicatedKey.description: Use a dedicated KMS key instead of the default account kms key

LoggingDestinations.description: AWS: where logs from the console session will be sent

CostCentre.description: A cost centre tag to apply to all components the account belongs to

DeploymentProfiles.description: Account specific DeploymentProfiles to apply across all account components

Domain.description: The id of a Domain Reference to use as the default

Alias.description: Control the alias of the KMS Key

IncludeSeed.description: Include a unique seed in the alias to ensure it is unique in the account

Id.description: A hamlet specific unique Id for the Account

Encryption.description: Manage at-rest encryption of log storage

Modules.description: Modules to import and apply for any component that belongs to the account

Name.description: A hamlet specific unique name for the Account - Uses Id if not defined

Operations.description: Account wide control over the operations object store created within segments

Expiration.description: The maximum time to keep opbjects in operations stores

Plugins.description: Pluings to import and apply for any component that belongs to the account

PolicyProfiles.description: Account specific PolicyProfiles to apply across all account components

Profiles.description: Account wide profiles to apply to account and child resources

Deployment.description: The id of a DeploymentProfile Reference or Account attribute to apply to all components

Policy.description: The id of a PolicyProfile Reference or Account attribute to apply to all components

Provider.description: The name of the provider that the account belongs to

ProviderAuditing.description: Logging of cloud service provider actions

Encryption.description: Manage at-rest encryption of data storage

Scope.description: The Scope of the logging sent to this account - Account = this account, Tenancy = all accounts in tenancy

StorageLocations.description: Where to store the audit logs

Type.description: The type of storage to use

Prefix.description: A prefix to apply to objects store in logs - _provider = use the providers service name

ProviderId.description: The unique Id of the account from the provider

Region.description: The id of a Region Reference to use as the default

Registry.description: Manage the registries used to host account based copies for images

Registries.description: Defines the registries available for image hosting

ReplicaRegions.description: A list of regions to replicate registries to

ProviderIds.description: The provider Ids of provider accounts to share with

EncryptionSource.description: The encryption service to use to encrypt data

Versioning.description: Enable versioning on all account level object stores

Seed.description: A random seed to ensure global resource names are unique

Title.description: A long form title of the account for documentation

Volume.description: Account wide controls over block storage volumes

aws:SES.description: AWS: Simple Email Service Account wide configuration

IPAccessPolicy.description: Controls how IPAddressGroups are handled - deny: deny these groups - allow: only allow these groups

RuleSet.description: Ruleset details. Only one active per account

aws:ecsAccountSettings.description: AWS manage account level configuration of the Elastic Container Service

AlertProfiles.description: A collection of alert rules applied to a component

AlertRules.description: A alert filtering rule to forward alerts based on their severity

BaselineProfiles.description: The baseline components to use for a given baseilne function

BootstrapProfiles.description: A collection of boostraps to apply

bastion.description: The component type the profile applies to

computecluster.description: The component type the profile applies to

ec2.description: The component type the profile applies to

ecs.description: The component type the profile applies to

Bootstraps.description: User defined initialisation for virtual machine based components

Categories.description: A high level grouping of environments

CertificateBehaviours.description: How to format the hostname used in a certificate

Certificates.description: Mapping of a domain to a product certificate entry - the Id of the reference should be a product Id

Domain.description: The Id of a domain reference to map to a product

ComputeProviders.description: Policies to determine the compute services used to host a given resource

Containers.description: Compute policy for container based resources

Additional.description: Providers who will meet the additional compute capacity outside of the default

Weight.description: The ratio of containers allocated to the provider based on the configured providers

Default.description: Sets the default computer provider which will meet base capacity

RequiredCount.description: The minimum count of containers to run on the default provider

Weight.description: The ratio of containers allocated to the provider based on the configured providers

CountryGroups.description: A collection of Country Codes used for access control

DeploymentGroups.description: A collection of deployment units and their relationships

CompositeTemplate.description: A composite template file to include for this group

DistrictType.description: The DistrictType to include as part of the Deployment Group

Level.description: The deployment level to use for template generation

OutputPrefix.description: Overrides the prefix used when generating outputs - Defaults to the Id of the Group

Priority.description: The priority this group has in deployment mode processing

ResourceSets.description: Generate deployments based on resource labels across all units in the group

GroupDeploymentUnit.description: Does the resource set span all units in the group

ResourceLabels.description: The resource labels to include in the subset

DeploymentModes.description: A collection of deployment groups which are executed in a defined order

ExecutionPolicy.description: Defines how groups can be used in this deployment mode

Groups.description: A list of group ids in their deployment order

Membership.description: How deployment groups are included in the mode and their ordering

Operations.description: The deployment operations to complete for each deployment

GroupFilter.description: A regex filter to apply on group ids to include in the mode

Order.description: How to evalute the priority ordering

DeploymentProfiles.description: Creates a collection of configuration which can be applied to multiple components

Modes.description: A nested object with the deployment mode name as the root and childs based on component types

Domains.description: Represents a segment of a domain name

Bare.description: Use the name value of the domain as the full domain name value

Parents.description: The parent of this domain segment

Stem.description: The root stem domain name that children will be based on

Zone.description: The zone the endpoint belongs to

Enabled.description: Deprecated - here to override automatically added enabled attribute

IPAddressGroups.description: A collection of CIDR based IP Addresses used for access control

Destination.description: The type of logstore to use for this log file group - component is local and link is an external store

Link.description: A link to an external log store

LogFileProfiles.description: A collectio of log file groups based on component type

bastion.description: The component type the profile applies to

computecluster.description: The component type the profile applies to

ec2.description: The component type the profile applies to

ecs.description: The component type the profile applies to

LogFiles.description: A log file and its collection pattern

LogFilters.description: A filter to apply when searching log files

LoggingProfiles.description: A profile to describe logging rules for a component

ForwardingRules.description: Controls the forwarding of logs after they have landed in their initial logging location

Filter.description: The name of a Logfilter to apply to the forwarding rule

Links.description: The links of components which will accept fowarded logs

NetworkProfiles.description: A profile to desribe network level controls

Links.description: Apply network security rules based on links

PlacementProfiles.description: Determines where a component will be deployed to

DeploymentFramework.description: The deployment framework to use to generate the outputs for deployment

Provider.description: The provider to use to host the component

Region.description: The id of the region to host the component

PolicyProfiles.description: Creates a collection of configuration which can be applied to multiple components

Modes.description: A nested object with the deployment mode name as the root and childs based on component types

PortMappings.description: A mapping between two ports when dealing with translation or offload services

Enabled.description: Will the health check be run

Protocol.description: The protocol used for healthchecks. _protocol uses the ports protocol

*.description: Individual deployment-unit configuration overrides. Attribute must match the DeploymentUnit value.

Region.description: An override of the Region for a single DeploymentUnit.

Modes.description: A nested object with the deployment mode name as the root and childs based on component types
A nested object with the deployment mode name as the root and childs based on component types

Regions.description: A physical location for infrastructure deployment

CDNHTTPSProfile.description: Defines the TLS encryption profile used for HTTPS connections

GatewayHTTPSProfile.description: Defines the TLS encryption profile used for HTTPS connections

Defines the TLS encryption profile used for HTTPS connections

NodeTransitEncryption.description: Require the use of node to node transit encryption

ProtocolPolicy.description: Define the protocols the ES endpoints are available on

HTTPSProfile.description: Defines the TLS encryption profile used for HTTPS connections
Defines the TLS encryption profile used for HTTPS connections
Defines the TLS encryption profile used for HTTPS connections

Enabled.description: Deprecated - here to override automatically added enabled attribute

ServiceRoles.description: Security Roles assigned to cloud services

Description.description: A description to include as part of the Role

ServiceName.description: The Service domain name for the service you want to create the role for

SkuProfiles.description: Compute SKU model and hardware type.

Solutions.description: Defines the components that belong to a district

Layers.description: The layers to match in a given district

Id.description: The Id of a layer the solution applies to - * applies to all layers that match the type

Type.description: The type of layer the solution applies to
The type of district the solution applies to

Priority.description: The priority order for the inclusion of this solution - Lowest = last loaded

Active.description: Defines if the layer should be used. Automatically true if components are defined

Index.description: A unique index number used when ordering tiers

Replication.description: The type of storage replication to use

Tier.description: The storage tier to use for all volumes

data.description: A fixed volume to use for ES Data storage

Iops.description: For volume types which support provisioned IOPS, this sets the requested IOPS

Size.description: The size in GB of the volume

Type.description: The type of volume to provision - see provider for available types

Modes.description: A nested object with the deployment mode name as the root and childs based on component types
A nested object with the deployment mode name as the root and childs based on component types

Resource.description: Does a resource with the type exist

Length.description: Length of an Array at a given JSON path

Match.description: Does a JSON path match a value

NotEmpty.description: Is the value of a JSON path not emtpy

IgnoreChecks.description: A list of checks to ignore in cfn-lint

checkov.description: Run checkov on the file - https://github.com/bridgecrewio/checkov

Framework.description: The framework of the file to run testing against

SkipChecks.description: A list of checks to skip in checkov

*.description: The component type the profile applies to

VMImageProfiles.description: A virtual machine operating system configuration

*.description: The component type that the VMImage configuration belongs to.

Constraints.description: How to apply a match on the target

FieldsToMatch.description: Fields in an HTTP request to search for the target

Data.description: Qualifying data on the field - e.g used to specify a specific header

Type.description: The type of field to match for

Operators.description: Used to define number based operation matching

Sizes.description: Payload sizes to use byte matching

Targets.description: A list of waf value sets that are used to match the condition

Transformations.description: Transformations to perform on the target value before evaluating it

Scope.description: The scope of the label to match on either match on a rule namespace or an explicit label

Type.description: The type of condition to use for the rule

Action.description: The action to perform when the rule is matched

Action:BLOCK.description: Additional configuration when using the BLOCK action

CustomResponse.description: Return a custom HTTP response when the rule blocks a request

Body.description: The HTTP body to return in the response

ContentWAFValue.description: The key for a value in the profile WAF ValueSet

Headers.description: HTTP headers to include in the response

Key.description: The Key of the header uses the id if not provided

StatusCode.description: The HTTP Status code to return

Action:CHALLENGE.description: What to do when the WAF hits a challenge action

Engine.description: The type of challenge to issue

Rule.description: The name of rule from the WAFRules reference data

RuleGroup.description: The name of rule from the WAFRuleGroups reference data

Conditions.description: User defined WAF conditions which will be used to either enforce the rule or scope it

Condition.description: The name of the WAFCondition reference object to use

Negated.description: Should the result of the rule be negated

Engine.description: The engine of the rule that will be used to evaluate the traffic

Engine:RateLimit.description: Measures request rate based on client IP and applies an action when it hits the rate limit

IPAddressSource.description: The source of the IP address to apply rate limiting to - Client IP: TCP connection address, HTTPHeader: use a header with the IP listed

IPAddressSource:HTTPHeader.description: HTTP Header Specific IP Address Source Config

ApplyLimitWhenMissing.description: When the header is missing apply the rate limit

HeaderName.description: The name of the HTTP header to get the client IP from

Limit.description: The limit to activate the rule in, measured in requests / 5 mins

Engine:VendorManaged.description: Use a Vendor managed rule to apply dynamic controls

Action.description: The action to perform when the rule is matched

Name.description: The name of the rule inside the vendor ruleset - uses the child id if not set

DisabledRules.description: A list of rules within the managed rule which should be disabled

Parameters.description: Rule specific parameters used to apply additional configuration

RuleName.description: The name of the rule to use

RuleVersion.description: The version of the rule to use

Vendor.description: The name of the vendor the managed rule belongs to
